explanation: The report is not correct. Although 'msg' is only read (not written) in run_usock, it is also the ownership pointer returned by ws_receive_frame and is explicitly freed later with free(msg). Making 'msg' a pointer-to-const would prevent passing it to free without casting away the qualifier (free takes void *), which would either require an unsafe cast or changing ownership semantics. MISRA's “whenever possible” intent does not mandate adding const qualifiers when doing so would conflict with ownership (deallocation) or require casting away qualifiers. Therefore the current non-const declaration is justified and does not violate Rule 8.13 in this context.
